constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

results.title: Army eagles
results.creator_credit: Peter Spender and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: This documentary tells of the important role aviation plays by the Army in serving the ground forces pointing out the versatility of helicopters and light aircraft.

results.title: Armidale: provincial city
results.brief_description: Armidale is 300 miles north of Sydney in a district called New England. The film shows how the city owes its prosperity to the land, and includes a sequence on the University of New England.

results.title: Arguing the Toss of a Cat
results.brief_description: This lighthearted comedy features Victor the cat who wanders around a block of flats in a Melbourne dockside suburb. Rose and William are a young couple sharing the upstairs flat. Rose is a jazz singer auditioning for an overseas tour with a famous jazz band. William draws pictures for children’s storybooks. Rose wants William to go with her but William wants to stay put. They draw comfort from Victor and use him as a sounding board for their own side of what turns into an argument. However, the other two tenants want Victor to share their problems too.

results.title: Argentina
results.brief_description: Buenos Aires is the commercial, industrial, and financial centre of Argentina; the inland pampas region is the source of Argentina’s wealth. The interdependence of the city and the agricultural area is emphasised.

results.title: Area schools of Tasmania
results.brief_description: The first scene of this film shows some attractive views of rural scenery in Tasmania. It is perhaps easier to make rural life in Tasmania attractive than in some of the other Australian states, for Tasmania has been blessed with many rural scenes of great beauty. Most of these shots were taken in the Huon Valley; the camera then lingers on an Area School at Huonville. There must be, however, in all the other Australian states many attractive rural districts which would provide a suitable environment for an Area school. Tasmania has many attractive one-teacher schools. The school shown is situated at Longley in the mountain district behind Mount Wellington. Since the introduction of the first Area school, however, the number of small rural schools in Tasmania has been diminished by about one hundred.

results.title: Are you safe at home?
results.creator_credit: George Gorman, Peter Cock and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: Intelligent methods of preventing fire and of fighting it should it break out. Simple home fire rules are suggested, and types of fire extinguishers suitable for the home are displayed. We see how a family that is well-organised and keeps cool escapes from a burning house and manages to save the building and most of its contents. The graphic story of a man caught in a strange hotel room with both exits barred by flames, shows how even in this desperate predicament knowledge and cool-headedness can avert final disaster. (Award: Chicago)

results.title: Are You a Racist
results.brief_description: Eight volunteers, either claiming to be racist or victims of racism, spend five days in an isolated house - sharing each other’s company and exploring the issue of racism by talking together about their own feelings and experiences, with some extraordinary and unexpected results.

results.title: Are my ears on wrong?
results.creator_credit: Robert Phillip, David M. Thompson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Rise of Modernism in Music 1890-1935”.
A profile of Charles Ives, one of America’s most important twentieth century composers, including interviews with composers Aaron Copland and Elliot Carter, performances by the Chilingirian String Quartet and BBC Symphony Orchestra, dramatised sequences of Ives childhood, an extract from Ives’ “Concord Sonata” played by John Kirkpatrick and filmed in Ives own studio.
